NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to History and Graduate or the cell corresponding to Economics and Researcher?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {History} and {Graduate} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Mathematics and Graduate or the cell corresponding to History and PhD?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {History} and {PhD} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Engineering and Junior or the cell corresponding to Economics and PhD?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Engineering} and {Junior} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.66 to 0.86?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Computer Science, Faculty), (Economics, Faculty), (Arts, Freshman), (Economics, Freshman), (Engineering, Freshman), (Arts, Graduate), (Computer Science, Graduate), (Engineering, Graduate), (History, Graduate), (Computer Science, Junior), (Economics, Junior), (History, Junior), (Literature, Junior), (Economics, PhD), (Engineering, PhD), (Literature, PhD), (Mathematics, PhD), (Engineering, Researcher), (History, Researcher), (Mathematics, Researcher), (History, Senior), (Literature, Senior)}.
